instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 5V
threads.message: Hello. Got this board here. Very clean, no signs of corrosion. It negotiates only 5V with charger. Already checked for shorts, no shorts found. Replaced both <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>, same issue. Tried replacing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> too as I'm not getting <SIGNAL>CHGR_EN_MVR</SIGNAL>, but same result... I'm stuck... I'm not good at this new architectures, need to study more to understand how it works. Any ideas on what to do next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 5V
threads.message: What about <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and small coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 5V
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is stuck on 1V, how the hell I do to take off the shield that's over <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 5V
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is stuck on 1V"
Check diode mode to ground there.

Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.
Check resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23 (ohm scale).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 5V
threads.message:
Diode Mode to GND on PPBUS - 0.431

<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> - 5V
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> - 1,289V
VDDA/P - both@5V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL> - couldn't find a point that's not under the nasty shield to measure this one
AMON - 0V
BMON - 0V
<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> resistance - 3ohm
<CAPACITOR>C7023</CAPACITOR> resistance - 2.6ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 5V
threads.message:
All look good there; you should get there <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Remove F7000 and check <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> voltage.

<SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_IN</SIGNAL> is available at U/<RESISTOR>R6940</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 5V
threads.message: U/<RESISTOR>R6940</RESISTOR> are under the shield. Will try removing F7000

threads.message: Ran out of ISL here. Replaced it two times already. Waiting for new chips to arrive.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 5V
threads.message:
Then replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40.
First check R/<CAPACITOR>C7030</CAPACITOR>/40 and their traces.

threads.message: Changing <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40, or found bad discrete component?
